title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. After a special election in Texas, Mayra Flores will become America's first Mexican-born Congresswoman. Where's her district?

A. The Rio Grande Valley

B. The Red River Basin

C. The Permian Basin

D. The Hill Country

---

2. Which of these cryptocurrency firms suspended withdrawals?

A. Kelvin

B. Rankine

C. Celsius

D. Fahrenheit

---

3. The Fed's Open Market Committee hiked a key interest rate by 0.75% in a 10-1 vote. Who dissented?

A. James Bullard

B. Lisa Cook

C. Esther George

D. Arthur Burns

---

4. Revlon filed for Chapter 11 after repeated bailouts from its main owner. Who's that?

A. Debra Perelman

B. Ronald Perelman

C. S.J. Perelman

D. Rhea Perlman

---

5. Albrioza was approved in Canada but awaits a verdict from the FDA. What disease is the drug aimed at?

A. Parkinson's

B. Alzheimer's

C. Huntington's

D. Lou Gehrig's

---

6. Former Attorney General William Barr said that, after the last presidential election, fighting false tales of fraud was like playing what?

A. Pac-Man

B. Whac-A-Mole

C. Contract bridge

D. Clue

---

7. Bill Gates said cryptocurrencies and NFTs are 100% based on what?

A. The efficient markets hypothesis

B. The Black-Scholes valuation model

C. The greatest good for the greatest number

D. The greater fool theory

---

8. Per the latest data, who among affluent countries has had fewest Covid deaths per capita?

A. Japan

B. Israel

C. New Zealand

D. Germany

---

9. As people return to work in person, which of these techniques are they using to pacify dogs left home?

A. Spa treatments

B. Canine "beer"

C. Courtroom TV shows

D. All of the above

---

ANSWERS

1. A

2. C

3. C

4. B

5. D

6. B

7. D

8. A

9. D
